speaker: Sign-up Desk
lines: A ledger with bloodstain corners; contracts written in ink and afterthoughts.
The clerk's quill is a spear for paper.
'Name?' he asks. 'Or whatever you call yourself when people watch.'
He slides across a bronze token stamped with a pit and a promise.
'Lose the token, lose your purse. Lose your purse, lose your friends.'
He points you toward the tunnel with a thumb that has been broken properly.
A bell coughs twice; the crowd clears its throat in reply.
You are ink now. Let's see if you're also steel.
